trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGGYR3BYRONSBREAD_00398_IMMODESTMOUSE_000_000<tab>Welcome to Byron's Bread. Come to buy some of our produce, have you?

TEXT_REGGYR3BYRONSBREAD_00398_IMMODESTMOUSE_000_010<tab>I keep myself busy farming these lands. Although, it's hardly the most fertile of soil, and every year the harvest worsens... Some days I just want to give up.
TEXT_REGGYR3BYRONSBREAD_00398_IMMODESTMOUSE_000_011<tab>That being said, it's not as if we can all float on working at the quarry like the old days.
TEXT_REGGYR3BYRONSBREAD_00398_IMMODESTMOUSE_000_012<tab>No, we'd all be better served looking towards the future. Our children would not thank us for clinging to the past.

TEXT_REGGYR3BYRONSBREAD_00398_IMMODESTMOUSE_000_020<tab>It's a farm created by my grandfather, Byron. When the quarrying industry began to decline, he chose to become a farmer, so he could keep providing for his family.
TEXT_REGGYR3BYRONSBREAD_00398_IMMODESTMOUSE_000_021<tab>The name “Byron's Bread” came to be after the villagers developed a saying: every mother in Ala Gannha knows their bread is buttered by Byron.

TEXT_REGGYR3BYRONSBREAD_00398_IMMODESTMOUSE_000_022<tab>Grandpa actually passed away before he managed to reap his first harvest. He left the farm to Father and me, and we did our best to make it a success.
TEXT_REGGYR3BYRONSBREAD_00398_IMMODESTMOUSE_000_023<tab>I'll never forget what Grandpa did for us. His blood and sweat cultivated this land; I would disgrace his memory were I to abandon it.
